test_date_select() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1522
def test_date_select
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Date.new(2004, 6, 15)

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option value="2004" selected="selected">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6" selected="selected">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_3i" name="post[written_on(3i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15" selected="selected">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n}

  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, date_select("post", "written_on")
end
test_date_select_cant_override_discard_hour() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1851
def test_date_select_cant_override_discard_hour
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Date.new(2004, 6, 15)

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option value="2004" selected="selected">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6" selected="selected">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_3i" name="post[written_on(3i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15" selected="selected">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, date_select("post", "written_on", :discard_hour => false)
end
test_date_select_should_not_change_passed_options_hash() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 3022
def test_date_select_should_not_change_passed_options_hash
  @post = Post.new
  @post.updated_at = Time.local(2008, 7, 16, 23, 30)

  options = {
    :order => [ :year, :month, :day ],
    :default => { :year => 2008, :month => 7, :day => 16, :hour => 23, :minute => 30, :second => 1 },
    :discard_type => false,
    :include_blank => false,
    :ignore_date => false,
    :include_seconds => true
  }
  date_select(@post, :updated_at, options)

  # note: the literal hash is intentional to show that the actual options hash isn't modified
  #       don't change this!
  assert_equal({
    :order => [ :year, :month, :day ],
    :default => { :year => 2008, :month => 7, :day => 16, :hour => 23, :minute => 30, :second => 1 },
    :discard_type => false,
    :include_blank => false,
    :ignore_date => false,
    :include_seconds => true
  }, options)
end
test_date_select_with_auto_index() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1715
def test_date_select_with_auto_index
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Date.new(2004, 6, 15)
  id = 123

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_123_written_on_1i" name="post[#{id}][written_on(1i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option value="2004" selected="selected">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_123_written_on_2i" name="post[#{id}][written_on(2i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6" selected="selected">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_123_written_on_3i" name="post[#{id}][written_on(3i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15" selected="selected">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, date_select("post[]", "written_on")
end
test_date_select_with_custom_prompt() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1999
def test_date_select_with_custom_prompt
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Date.new(2004, 6, 15)

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="">Choose year</option>\n<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option value="2004" selected="selected">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="">Choose month</option>\n<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6" selected="selected">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_3i" name="post[written_on(3i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="">Choose day</option>\n<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15" selected="selected">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n}

  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, date_select("post", "written_on", :prompt => {:year => 'Choose year', :month => 'Choose month', :day => 'Choose day'})
end
test_date_select_with_default_prompt() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1979
def test_date_select_with_default_prompt
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Date.new(2004, 6, 15)

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="">Year</option>\n<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option value="2004" selected="selected">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="">Month</option>\n<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6" selected="selected">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_3i" name="post[written_on(3i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="">Day</option>\n<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15" selected="selected">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n}

  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, date_select("post", "written_on", :prompt => true)
end
test_date_select_with_different_order() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1735
def test_date_select_with_different_order
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Date.new(2004, 6, 15)

  expected =  %Q{<select id="post_written_on_3i" name="post[written_on(3i)]">\n}
  1.upto(31) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 15}>#{i}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]">\n}
  1.upto(12) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 6}>#{Date::MONTHNAMES[i]}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected <<  %Q{<select id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]">\n}
  1999.upto(2009) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 2004}>#{i}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, date_select("post", "written_on", :order => [:day, :month, :year])
end
test_date_select_with_html_options() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1870
def test_date_select_with_html_options
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Date.new(2004, 6, 15)

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]" class="selector">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option value="2004" selected="selected">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]" class="selector">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6" selected="selected">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_3i" name="post[written_on(3i)]" class="selector">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15" selected="selected">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n}

  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, date_select("post", "written_on", {}, :class => 'selector')
end
test_date_select_with_html_options_within_fields_for() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1890
def test_date_select_with_html_options_within_fields_for
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Date.new(2004, 6, 15)

  output_buffer = fields_for :post, @post do |f|
    concat f.date_select(:written_on, {}, :class => 'selector')
  end

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]" class="selector">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option value="2004" selected="selected">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]" class="selector">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6" selected="selected">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_3i" name="post[written_on(3i)]" class="selector">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15" selected="selected">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n}

  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, output_buffer
end
test_date_select_with_index() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1695
def test_date_select_with_index
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Date.new(2004, 6, 15)
  id = 456

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_456_written_on_1i" name="post[#{id}][written_on(1i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option value="2004" selected="selected">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_456_written_on_2i" name="post[#{id}][written_on(2i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6" selected="selected">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_456_written_on_3i" name="post[#{id}][written_on(3i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15" selected="selected">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, date_select("post", "written_on", :index => id)
end
test_date_select_with_nil() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1754
def test_date_select_with_nil
  @post = Post.new

  start_year = Time.now.year-5
  end_year   = Time.now.year+5
  expected =   %Q{<select id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]">\n}
  start_year.upto(end_year) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == Time.now.year}>#{i}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]">\n}
  1.upto(12) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == Time.now.month}>#{Date::MONTHNAMES[i]}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_3i" name="post[written_on(3i)]">\n}
  1.upto(31) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == Time.now.day}>#{i}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, date_select("post", "written_on")
end
test_date_select_with_nil_and_blank() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1774
def test_date_select_with_nil_and_blank
  @post = Post.new

  start_year = Time.now.year-5
  end_year   = Time.now.year+5
  expected =   %Q{<select id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]">\n}
  expected << "<option value=\"\"></option>\n"
  start_year.upto(end_year) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}">#{i}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]">\n}
  expected << "<option value=\"\"></option>\n"
  1.upto(12) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}">#{Date::MONTHNAMES[i]}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_3i" name="post[written_on(3i)]">\n}
  expected << "<option value=\"\"></option>\n"
  1.upto(31) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}">#{i}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, date_select("post", "written_on", :include_blank => true)
end
test_date_select_with_nil_and_blank_and_discard_month() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1817
def test_date_select_with_nil_and_blank_and_discard_month
  @post = Post.new

  start_year = Time.now.year-5
  end_year   = Time.now.year+5

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]">\n}
  expected << "<option value=\"\"></option>\n"
  start_year.upto(end_year) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}">#{i}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << '<input name="post[written_on(2i)]" type="hidden" id="post_written_on_2i" value="1"/>' + "\n"
  expected << '<input name="post[written_on(3i)]" type="hidden" id="post_written_on_3i" value="1"/>' + "\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, date_select("post", "written_on", :discard_month => true, :include_blank=>true)
end
test_date_select_with_nil_and_blank_and_discard_year() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1833
def test_date_select_with_nil_and_blank_and_discard_year
  @post = Post.new

  expected = '<input id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]" type="hidden" value="1" />' + "\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]">\n}
  expected << "<option value=\"\"></option>\n"
  1.upto(12) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}">#{Date::MONTHNAMES[i]}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_3i" name="post[written_on(3i)]">\n}
  expected << "<option value=\"\"></option>\n"
  1.upto(31) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}">#{i}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, date_select("post", "written_on", :discard_year => true, :include_blank=>true)
end
test_date_select_with_nil_and_blank_and_order() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1797
def test_date_select_with_nil_and_blank_and_order
  @post = Post.new

  start_year = Time.now.year-5
  end_year   = Time.now.year+5

  expected = '<input name="post[written_on(3i)]" type="hidden" id="post_written_on_3i" value="1"/>' + "\n"
  expected <<   %Q{<select id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]">\n}
  expected << "<option value=\"\"></option>\n"
  start_year.upto(end_year) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}">#{i}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]">\n}
  expected << "<option value=\"\"></option>\n"
  1.upto(12) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}">#{Date::MONTHNAMES[i]}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, date_select("post", "written_on", :order=>[:year, :month], :include_blank=>true)
end
test_date_select_with_nil_value_and_no_start_and_end_year() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2547
def test_date_select_with_nil_value_and_no_start_and_end_year
  expected =  %Q(<select id="date_first_year" name="date[first][year]">\n)
  (Date.today.year-5).upto(Date.today.year+5) { |y| expected << %Q(<option value="#{y}">#{y}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_month" name="date[first][month]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_day" name="date[first][day]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, select_date(nil, :prefix => "date[first]")
end
test_date_select_with_selected() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1542
def test_date_select_with_selected
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Date.new(2004, 6, 15)

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option selected="selected" value="2004">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6">June</option>\n<option value="7" selected="selected">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_3i" name="post[written_on(3i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10" selected="selected">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n}

  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, date_select("post", "written_on", :selected => Date.new(2004, 07, 10))
end
test_date_select_with_selected_nil() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1562
def test_date_select_with_selected_nil
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Date.new(2004, 6, 15)

  expected = '<input id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]" type="hidden" value="1"/>' + "\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value=""></option>\n<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_3i" name="post[written_on(3i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value=""></option>\n<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n}

  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, date_select("post", "written_on", include_blank: true, discard_year: true, selected: nil)
end
test_date_select_with_separator() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1914
def test_date_select_with_separator
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Date.new(2004, 6, 15)

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option value="2004" selected="selected">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " / "

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6" selected="selected">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " / "

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_3i" name="post[written_on(3i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15" selected="selected">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n}

  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, date_select("post", "written_on", { :date_separator => " / " })
end
test_date_select_with_separator_and_order() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1938
def test_date_select_with_separator_and_order
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Date.new(2004, 6, 15)

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_written_on_3i" name="post[written_on(3i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15" selected="selected">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " / "

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6" selected="selected">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " / "

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option value="2004" selected="selected">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, date_select("post", "written_on", { :order => [:day, :month, :year], :date_separator => " / " })
end
test_date_select_with_separator_and_order_and_year_discarded() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1961
def test_date_select_with_separator_and_order_and_year_discarded
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Date.new(2004, 6, 15)

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_written_on_3i" name="post[written_on(3i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15" selected="selected">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " / "

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6" selected="selected">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]" value="2004" />\n}

  assert_dom_equal expected, date_select("post", "written_on", { :order => [:day, :month, :year], :discard_year => true, :date_separator => " / " })
end
test_date_select_with_zero_value_and_no_end_year() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2514
def test_date_select_with_zero_value_and_no_end_year
  expected =  %Q(<select id="date_first_year" name="date[first][year]">\n)
  last_year = Time.now.year + 5
  2003.upto(last_year) { |y| expected << %Q(<option value="#{y}">#{y}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_month" name="date[first][month]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_day" name="date[first][day]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, select_date(0, :start_year => 2003, :prefix => "date[first]")
end
test_date_select_with_zero_value_and_no_start_and_end_year() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2531
def test_date_select_with_zero_value_and_no_start_and_end_year
  expected =  %Q(<select id="date_first_year" name="date[first][year]">\n)
  (Date.today.year-5).upto(Date.today.year+5) { |y| expected << %Q(<option value="#{y}">#{y}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_month" name="date[first][month]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_day" name="date[first][day]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, select_date(0, :prefix => "date[first]")
end
test_date_select_with_zero_value_and_no_start_year() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2498
def test_date_select_with_zero_value_and_no_start_year
  expected =  %Q(<select id="date_first_year" name="date[first][year]">\n)
  (Date.today.year-5).upto(Date.today.year+1) { |y| expected << %Q(<option value="#{y}">#{y}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_month" name="date[first][month]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_first_day" name="date[first][day]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, select_date(0, :end_year => Date.today.year+1, :prefix => "date[first]")
end
test_date_select_within_fields_for() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1647
def test_date_select_within_fields_for
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Date.new(2004, 6, 15)

  output_buffer = fields_for :post, @post do |f|
    concat f.date_select(:written_on)
  end

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]">\n<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option selected="selected" value="2004">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n</select>\n}
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]">\n<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option selected="selected" value="6">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n</select>\n}
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_3i" name="post[written_on(3i)]">\n<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option selected="selected" value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n</select>\n}

  assert_dom_equal(expected, output_buffer)
end
test_date_select_within_fields_for_with_blank_index() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1678
def test_date_select_within_fields_for_with_blank_index
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Date.new(2004, 6, 15)
  id = nil

  output_buffer = fields_for :post, @post, :index => id do |f|
    concat f.date_select(:written_on)
  end


  expected = %Q{<select id="post_#{id}_written_on_1i" name="post[#{id}][written_on(1i)]">\n<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option selected="selected" value="2004">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n</select>\n}
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_#{id}_written_on_2i" name="post[#{id}][written_on(2i)]">\n<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option selected="selected" value="6">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n</select>\n}
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_#{id}_written_on_3i" name="post[#{id}][written_on(3i)]">\n<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option selected="selected" value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n</select>\n}

  assert_dom_equal(expected, output_buffer)
end
test_date_select_within_fields_for_with_index() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1662
def test_date_select_within_fields_for_with_index
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Date.new(2004, 6, 15)
  id = 27

  output_buffer = fields_for :post, @post, :index => id do |f|
    concat f.date_select(:written_on)
  end

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_#{id}_written_on_1i" name="post[#{id}][written_on(1i)]">\n<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option selected="selected" value="2004">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n</select>\n}
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_#{id}_written_on_2i" name="post[#{id}][written_on(2i)]">\n<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option selected="selected" value="6">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n</select>\n}
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_#{id}_written_on_3i" name="post[#{id}][written_on(3i)]">\n<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option selected="selected" value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n</select>\n}

  assert_dom_equal(expected, output_buffer)
end
test_date_select_without_day() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1580
def test_date_select_without_day
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Date.new(2004, 6, 15)

  expected = "<input type=\"hidden\" id=\"post_written_on_3i\" name=\"post[written_on(3i)]\" value=\"1\" />\n"

  expected <<  %Q{<select id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6" selected="selected">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option value="2004" selected="selected">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, date_select("post", "written_on", :order => [ :month, :year ])
end
test_date_select_without_day_and_month() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1597
def test_date_select_without_day_and_month
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Date.new(2004, 2, 29)

  expected = "<input type=\"hidden\" id=\"post_written_on_2i\" name=\"post[written_on(2i)]\" value=\"2\" />\n"
  expected << "<input type=\"hidden\" id=\"post_written_on_3i\" name=\"post[written_on(3i)]\" value=\"1\" />\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option value="2004" selected="selected">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, date_select("post", "written_on", :order => [ :year ])
end
test_date_select_without_day_and_with_disabled_html_option() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1630
def test_date_select_without_day_and_with_disabled_html_option
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Date.new(2004, 6, 15)

  expected = "<input type=\"hidden\" id=\"post_written_on_3i\" disabled=\"disabled\" name=\"post[written_on(3i)]\" value=\"1\" />\n"

  expected <<  %Q{<select id="post_written_on_2i" disabled="disabled" name="post[written_on(2i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6" selected="selected">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_1i" disabled="disabled" name="post[written_on(1i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option value="2004" selected="selected">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, date_select("post", "written_on", { :order => [ :month, :year ] }, :disabled => true)
end
test_date_select_without_day_with_separator() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1611
def test_date_select_without_day_with_separator
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Date.new(2004, 6, 15)

  expected = "<input type=\"hidden\" id=\"post_written_on_3i\" name=\"post[written_on(3i)]\" value=\"1\" />\n"

  expected <<  %Q{<select id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6" selected="selected">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << "/"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option value="2004" selected="selected">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, date_select("post", "written_on", :date_separator => '/', :order => [ :month, :year ])
end
test_datetime_select() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2244
def test_datetime_select
  @post = Post.new
  @post.updated_at = Time.local(2004, 6, 15, 16, 35)

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_1i" name="post[updated_at(1i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option value="2004" selected="selected">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_2i" name="post[updated_at(2i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6" selected="selected">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_3i" name="post[updated_at(3i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15" selected="selected">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " &mdash; "

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_4i" name="post[updated_at(4i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="00">00</option>\n<option value="01">01</option>\n<option value="02">02</option>\n<option value="03">03</option>\n<option value="04">04</option>\n<option value="05">05</option>\n<option value="06">06</option>\n<option value="07">07</option>\n<option value="08">08</option>\n<option value="09">09</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16" selected="selected">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << " : "
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_5i" name="post[updated_at(5i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="00">00</option>\n<option value="01">01</option>\n<option value="02">02</option>\n<option value="03">03</option>\n<option value="04">04</option>\n<option value="05">05</option>\n<option value="06">06</option>\n<option value="07">07</option>\n<option value="08">08</option>\n<option value="09">09</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n<option value="32">32</option>\n<option value="33">33</option>\n<option value="34">34</option>\n<option value="35" selected="selected">35</option>\n<option value="36">36</option>\n<option value="37">37</option>\n<option value="38">38</option>\n<option value="39">39</option>\n<option value="40">40</option>\n<option value="41">41</option>\n<option value="42">42</option>\n<option value="43">43</option>\n<option value="44">44</option>\n<option value="45">45</option>\n<option value="46">46</option>\n<option value="47">47</option>\n<option value="48">48</option>\n<option value="49">49</option>\n<option value="50">50</option>\n<option value="51">51</option>\n<option value="52">52</option>\n<option value="53">53</option>\n<option value="54">54</option>\n<option value="55">55</option>\n<option value="56">56</option>\n<option value="57">57</option>\n<option value="58">58</option>\n<option value="59">59</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, datetime_select("post", "updated_at")
end
test_datetime_select_defaults_to_time_zone_now_when_config_time_zone_is_set() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2329
def test_datetime_select_defaults_to_time_zone_now_when_config_time_zone_is_set
  # The love zone is UTC+0
  mytz = Class.new(ActiveSupport::TimeZone) {
    attr_accessor :now
  }.create('tenderlove', 0)

  now       = Time.mktime(2004, 6, 15, 16, 35, 0)
  mytz.now  = now
  Time.zone = mytz

  assert_equal mytz, Time.zone

  @post = Post.new

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_1i" name="post[updated_at(1i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1999">1999</option>\n<option value="2000">2000</option>\n<option value="2001">2001</option>\n<option value="2002">2002</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option value="2004" selected="selected">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n<option value="2006">2006</option>\n<option value="2007">2007</option>\n<option value="2008">2008</option>\n<option value="2009">2009</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_2i" name="post[updated_at(2i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">January</option>\n<option value="2">February</option>\n<option value="3">March</option>\n<option value="4">April</option>\n<option value="5">May</option>\n<option value="6" selected="selected">June</option>\n<option value="7">July</option>\n<option value="8">August</option>\n<option value="9">September</option>\n<option value="10">October</option>\n<option value="11">November</option>\n<option value="12">December</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_3i" name="post[updated_at(3i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="1">1</option>\n<option value="2">2</option>\n<option value="3">3</option>\n<option value="4">4</option>\n<option value="5">5</option>\n<option value="6">6</option>\n<option value="7">7</option>\n<option value="8">8</option>\n<option value="9">9</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15" selected="selected">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " &mdash; "

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_4i" name="post[updated_at(4i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="00">00</option>\n<option value="01">01</option>\n<option value="02">02</option>\n<option value="03">03</option>\n<option value="04">04</option>\n<option value="05">05</option>\n<option value="06">06</option>\n<option value="07">07</option>\n<option value="08">08</option>\n<option value="09">09</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16" selected="selected">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << " : "
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_5i" name="post[updated_at(5i)]">\n}
  expected << %Q{<option value="00">00</option>\n<option value="01">01</option>\n<option value="02">02</option>\n<option value="03">03</option>\n<option value="04">04</option>\n<option value="05">05</option>\n<option value="06">06</option>\n<option value="07">07</option>\n<option value="08">08</option>\n<option value="09">09</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n<option value="32">32</option>\n<option value="33">33</option>\n<option value="34">34</option>\n<option value="35" selected="selected">35</option>\n<option value="36">36</option>\n<option value="37">37</option>\n<option value="38">38</option>\n<option value="39">39</option>\n<option value="40">40</option>\n<option value="41">41</option>\n<option value="42">42</option>\n<option value="43">43</option>\n<option value="44">44</option>\n<option value="45">45</option>\n<option value="46">46</option>\n<option value="47">47</option>\n<option value="48">48</option>\n<option value="49">49</option>\n<option value="50">50</option>\n<option value="51">51</option>\n<option value="52">52</option>\n<option value="53">53</option>\n<option value="54">54</option>\n<option value="55">55</option>\n<option value="56">56</option>\n<option value="57">57</option>\n<option value="58">58</option>\n<option value="59">59</option>\n}
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, datetime_select("post", "updated_at")
ensure
  Time.zone = nil
end
test_datetime_select_disabled_and_discard_minute() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2843
def test_datetime_select_disabled_and_discard_minute
  @post = Post.new
  @post.updated_at = Time.local(2004, 6, 15, 15, 16, 35)

  expected = %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_1i" disabled="disabled" name="post[updated_at(1i)]">\n}
  1999.upto(2009) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 2004}>#{i}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_2i" disabled="disabled" name="post[updated_at(2i)]">\n}
  1.upto(12) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 6}>#{Date::MONTHNAMES[i]}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_3i" disabled="disabled" name="post[updated_at(3i)]">\n}
  1.upto(31) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{i}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 15}>#{i}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " &mdash; "

  expected << %Q{<select id="post_updated_at_4i" disabled="disabled" name="post[updated_at(4i)]">\n}
  0.upto(23) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 15}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_updated_at_5i" disabled="disabled" name="post[updated_at(5i)]" value="16" />\n}

  assert_dom_equal expected, datetime_select("post", "updated_at", :discard_minute => true, :disabled => true)
end
