test_select_time_with_separator() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 1373
def test_select_time_with_separator
  expected = %Q(<input name="date[year]" id="date_year" value="2003" type="hidden" />\n)
  expected << %Q(<input name="date[month]" id="date_month" value="8" type="hidden" />\n)
  expected << %Q(<input name="date[day]" id="date_day" value="16" type="hidden" />\n)
  expected << %Q(<select id="date_hour" name="date[hour]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="00">00</option>\n<option value="01">01</option>\n<option value="02">02</option>\n<option value="03">03</option>\n<option value="04">04</option>\n<option value="05">05</option>\n<option value="06">06</option>\n<option value="07">07</option>\n<option value="08" selected="selected">08</option>\n<option value="09">09</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " : "

  expected << %Q(<select id="date_minute" name="date[minute]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="00">00</option>\n<option value="01">01</option>\n<option value="02">02</option>\n<option value="03">03</option>\n<option value="04" selected="selected">04</option>\n<option value="05">05</option>\n<option value="06">06</option>\n<option value="07">07</option>\n<option value="08">08</option>\n<option value="09">09</option>\n<option value="10">10</option>\n<option value="11">11</option>\n<option value="12">12</option>\n<option value="13">13</option>\n<option value="14">14</option>\n<option value="15">15</option>\n<option value="16">16</option>\n<option value="17">17</option>\n<option value="18">18</option>\n<option value="19">19</option>\n<option value="20">20</option>\n<option value="21">21</option>\n<option value="22">22</option>\n<option value="23">23</option>\n<option value="24">24</option>\n<option value="25">25</option>\n<option value="26">26</option>\n<option value="27">27</option>\n<option value="28">28</option>\n<option value="29">29</option>\n<option value="30">30</option>\n<option value="31">31</option>\n<option value="32">32</option>\n<option value="33">33</option>\n<option value="34">34</option>\n<option value="35">35</option>\n<option value="36">36</option>\n<option value="37">37</option>\n<option value="38">38</option>\n<option value="39">39</option>\n<option value="40">40</option>\n<option value="41">41</option>\n<option value="42">42</option>\n<option value="43">43</option>\n<option value="44">44</option>\n<option value="45">45</option>\n<option value="46">46</option>\n<option value="47">47</option>\n<option value="48">48</option>\n<option value="49">49</option>\n<option value="50">50</option>\n<option value="51">51</option>\n<option value="52">52</option>\n<option value="53">53</option>\n<option value="54">54</option>\n<option value="55">55</option>\n<option value="56">56</option>\n<option value="57">57</option>\n<option value="58">58</option>\n<option value="59">59</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, select_time(Time.mktime(2003, 8, 16, 8, 4, 18), :time_separator => ' : ')
  assert_dom_equal expected, select_time(Time.mktime(2003, 8, 16, 8, 4, 18), :time_separator => ' : ', :include_seconds => false)
end
test_select_year() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 416
def test_select_year
  expected = %Q(<select id="date_year" name="date[year]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="2003" selected="selected">2003</option>\n<option value="2004">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, select_year(Time.mktime(2003, 8, 16), :start_year => 2003, :end_year => 2005)
  assert_dom_equal expected, select_year(2003, :start_year => 2003, :end_year => 2005)
end
test_select_year_descending() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 454
def test_select_year_descending
  expected = %Q(<select id="date_year" name="date[year]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="2005" selected="selected">2005</option>\n<option value="2004">2004</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, select_year(Time.mktime(2005, 8, 16), :start_year => 2005, :end_year => 2003)
  assert_dom_equal expected, select_year(2005, :start_year => 2005, :end_year => 2003)
end
test_select_year_with_custom_prompt() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 492
def test_select_year_with_custom_prompt
  expected = %Q(<select id="date_year" name="date[year]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="">Choose year</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option value="2004">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, select_year(nil, :start_year => 2003, :end_year => 2005, :prompt => 'Choose year')
end
test_select_year_with_default_prompt() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 484
def test_select_year_with_default_prompt
  expected = %Q(<select id="date_year" name="date[year]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="">Year</option>\n<option value="2003">2003</option>\n<option value="2004">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, select_year(nil, :start_year => 2003, :end_year => 2005, :prompt => true)
end
test_select_year_with_disabled() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 425
def test_select_year_with_disabled
  expected = %Q(<select id="date_year" name="date[year]" disabled="disabled">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="2003" selected="selected">2003</option>\n<option value="2004">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, select_year(Time.mktime(2003, 8, 16), :disabled => true, :start_year => 2003, :end_year => 2005)
  assert_dom_equal expected, select_year(2003, :disabled => true, :start_year => 2003, :end_year => 2005)
end
test_select_year_with_field_name_override() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 434
def test_select_year_with_field_name_override
  expected = %Q(<select id="date_annee" name="date[annee]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="2003" selected="selected">2003</option>\n<option value="2004">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, select_year(Time.mktime(2003, 8, 16), :start_year => 2003, :end_year => 2005, :field_name => 'annee')
  assert_dom_equal expected, select_year(2003, :start_year => 2003, :end_year => 2005, :field_name => 'annee')
end
test_select_year_with_hidden() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 463
def test_select_year_with_hidden
  assert_dom_equal "<input type=\"hidden\" id=\"date_year\" name=\"date[year]\" value=\"2007\" />\n", select_year(2007, :use_hidden => true)
end
test_select_year_with_hidden_and_field_name() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 467
def test_select_year_with_hidden_and_field_name
  assert_dom_equal "<input type=\"hidden\" id=\"date_anno\" name=\"date[anno]\" value=\"2007\" />\n", select_year(2007, :use_hidden => true, :field_name => 'anno')
end
test_select_year_with_html_options() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 471
def test_select_year_with_html_options
  expected = %Q(<select id="date_year" name="date[year]" class="selector" accesskey="M">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="2003" selected="selected">2003</option>\n<option value="2004">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, select_year(Time.mktime(2003, 8, 16), {:start_year => 2003, :end_year => 2005}, :class => 'selector', :accesskey => 'M')
  #result = select_year(Time.mktime(2003, 8, 16), {:start_year => 2003, :end_year => 2005}, :class => 'selector', :accesskey => 'M')
  #assert result.include?('<select id="date_year" name="date[year]"')
  #assert result.include?('class="selector"')
  #assert result.include?('accesskey="M"')
  #assert result.include?('<option value="2003"')
end
test_select_year_with_type_discarding() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 443
def test_select_year_with_type_discarding
  expected = %Q(<select id="date_year" name="date_year">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="2003" selected="selected">2003</option>\n<option value="2004">2004</option>\n<option value="2005">2005</option>\n)
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, select_year(
    Time.mktime(2003, 8, 16), :prefix => "date_year", :discard_type => true, :start_year => 2003, :end_year => 2005)
  assert_dom_equal expected, select_year(
    2003, :prefix => "date_year", :discard_type => true, :start_year => 2003, :end_year => 2005)
end
test_time_ago_in_words() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 194
def test_time_ago_in_words
  assert_equal "about 1 year", time_ago_in_words(1.year.ago - 1.day)
end
test_time_ago_in_words_passes_include_seconds() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 138
def test_time_ago_in_words_passes_include_seconds
  assert_equal "less than 20 seconds", time_ago_in_words(15.seconds.ago, :include_seconds => true)
  assert_equal "less than a minute", time_ago_in_words(15.seconds.ago, :include_seconds => false)
end
test_time_select() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2019
def test_time_select
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Time.local(2004, 6, 15, 15, 16, 35)

  expected = %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]" value="2004" />\n}
  expected << %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]" value="6" />\n}
  expected << %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_3i" name="post[written_on(3i)]" value="15" />\n}

  expected << %Q(<select id="post_written_on_4i" name="post[written_on(4i)]">\n)
  0.upto(23) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 15}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << " : "
  expected << %Q(<select id="post_written_on_5i" name="post[written_on(5i)]">\n)
  0.upto(59) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 16}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, time_select("post", "written_on")
end
test_time_select_should_not_change_passed_options_hash() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 3074
def test_time_select_should_not_change_passed_options_hash
  @post = Post.new
  @post.updated_at = Time.local(2008, 7, 16, 23, 30)

  options = {
    :order => [ :year, :month, :day ],
    :default => { :year => 2008, :month => 7, :day => 16, :hour => 23, :minute => 30, :second => 1 },
    :discard_type => false,
    :include_blank => false,
    :ignore_date => false,
    :include_seconds => true
  }
  time_select(@post, :updated_at, options)

  # note: the literal hash is intentional to show that the actual options hash isn't modified
  #       don't change this!
  assert_equal({
    :order => [ :year, :month, :day ],
    :default => { :year => 2008, :month => 7, :day => 16, :hour => 23, :minute => 30, :second => 1 },
    :discard_type => false,
    :include_blank => false,
    :ignore_date => false,
    :include_seconds => true
  }, options)
end
test_time_select_with_custom_prompt() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2204
def test_time_select_with_custom_prompt
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Time.local(2004, 6, 15, 15, 16, 35)

  expected = %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]" value="2004" />\n}
  expected << %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]" value="6" />\n}
  expected << %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_3i" name="post[written_on(3i)]" value="15" />\n}

  expected << %Q(<select id="post_written_on_4i" name="post[written_on(4i)]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="">Choose hour</option>\n)
  0.upto(23) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 15}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << " : "
  expected << %Q(<select id="post_written_on_5i" name="post[written_on(5i)]">\n)
      expected << %Q(<option value="">Choose minute</option>\n)
  0.upto(59) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 16}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, time_select("post", "written_on", :prompt => {:hour => 'Choose hour', :minute => 'Choose minute'})
end
test_time_select_with_default_prompt() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2183
def test_time_select_with_default_prompt
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Time.local(2004, 6, 15, 15, 16, 35)

  expected = %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]" value="2004" />\n}
  expected << %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]" value="6" />\n}
  expected << %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_3i" name="post[written_on(3i)]" value="15" />\n}

  expected << %Q(<select id="post_written_on_4i" name="post[written_on(4i)]">\n)
  expected << %Q(<option value="">Hour</option>\n)
  0.upto(23) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 15}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << " : "
  expected << %Q(<select id="post_written_on_5i" name="post[written_on(5i)]">\n)
      expected << %Q(<option value="">Minute</option>\n)
  0.upto(59) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 16}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, time_select("post", "written_on", :prompt => true)
end
test_time_select_with_disabled_html_option() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2225
def test_time_select_with_disabled_html_option
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Time.local(2004, 6, 15, 15, 16, 35)

  expected = %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_1i" disabled="disabled" name="post[written_on(1i)]" value="2004" />\n}
  expected << %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_2i" disabled="disabled" name="post[written_on(2i)]" value="6" />\n}
  expected << %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_3i" disabled="disabled" name="post[written_on(3i)]" value="15" />\n}

  expected << %Q(<select id="post_written_on_4i" disabled="disabled" name="post[written_on(4i)]">\n)
  0.upto(23) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 15}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << " : "
  expected << %Q(<select id="post_written_on_5i" disabled="disabled" name="post[written_on(5i)]">\n)
  0.upto(59) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 16}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, time_select("post", "written_on", {}, :disabled => true)
end
test_time_select_with_html_options() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2114
def test_time_select_with_html_options
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Time.local(2004, 6, 15, 15, 16, 35)

  expected = %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]" value="2004" />\n}
  expected << %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]" value="6" />\n}
  expected << %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_3i" name="post[written_on(3i)]" value="15" />\n}

  expected << %Q(<select id="post_written_on_4i" name="post[written_on(4i)]" class="selector">\n)
  0.upto(23) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 15}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << " : "
  expected << %Q(<select id="post_written_on_5i" name="post[written_on(5i)]" class="selector">\n)
  0.upto(59) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 16}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, time_select("post", "written_on", {}, :class => 'selector')
end
test_time_select_with_html_options_within_fields_for() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2133
def test_time_select_with_html_options_within_fields_for
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Time.local(2004, 6, 15, 15, 16, 35)

  output_buffer = fields_for :post, @post do |f|
    concat f.time_select(:written_on, {}, :class => 'selector')
  end

  expected = %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]" value="2004" />\n}
  expected << %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]" value="6" />\n}
  expected << %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_3i" name="post[written_on(3i)]" value="15" />\n}

  expected << %Q(<select id="post_written_on_4i" name="post[written_on(4i)]" class="selector">\n)
  0.upto(23) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 15}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << " : "
  expected << %Q(<select id="post_written_on_5i" name="post[written_on(5i)]" class="selector">\n)
  0.upto(59) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 16}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, output_buffer
end
test_time_select_with_seconds() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2091
def test_time_select_with_seconds
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Time.local(2004, 6, 15, 15, 16, 35)

  expected = %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]" value="2004" />\n}
  expected << %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]" value="6" />\n}
  expected << %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_3i" name="post[written_on(3i)]" value="15" />\n}

  expected << %Q(<select id="post_written_on_4i" name="post[written_on(4i)]">\n)
  0.upto(23) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 15}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << " : "
  expected << %Q(<select id="post_written_on_5i" name="post[written_on(5i)]">\n)
  0.upto(59) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 16}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << " : "
  expected << %Q(<select id="post_written_on_6i" name="post[written_on(6i)]">\n)
  0.upto(59) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 35}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, time_select("post", "written_on", :include_seconds => true)
end
test_time_select_with_selected() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2038
def test_time_select_with_selected
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Time.local(2004, 6, 15, 15, 16, 35)

  expected = %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]" value="2004" />\n}
  expected << %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]" value="6" />\n}
  expected << %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_3i" name="post[written_on(3i)]" value="15" />\n}

  expected << %Q(<select id="post_written_on_4i" name="post[written_on(4i)]">\n)
  0.upto(23) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 12}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << " : "
  expected << %Q(<select id="post_written_on_5i" name="post[written_on(5i)]">\n)
  0.upto(59) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 20}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, time_select("post", "written_on", selected: Time.local(2004, 6, 15, 12, 20, 30))
end
test_time_select_with_selected_nil() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2057
def test_time_select_with_selected_nil
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Time.local(2004, 6, 15, 15, 16, 35)

  expected = %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]" value="1" />\n}
  expected << %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]" value="1" />\n}
  expected << %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_3i" name="post[written_on(3i)]" value="1" />\n}

  expected << %Q(<select id="post_written_on_4i" name="post[written_on(4i)]">\n)
  0.upto(23) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}">#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << " : "
  expected << %Q(<select id="post_written_on_5i" name="post[written_on(5i)]">\n)
  0.upto(59) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}">#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, time_select("post", "written_on", discard_year: true, discard_month: true, discard_day: true, selected: nil)
end
test_time_select_with_separator() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2156
def test_time_select_with_separator
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Time.local(2004, 6, 15, 15, 16, 35)

  expected = %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]" value="2004" />\n}
  expected << %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]" value="6" />\n}
  expected << %Q{<input type="hidden" id="post_written_on_3i" name="post[written_on(3i)]" value="15" />\n}

  expected << %Q(<select id="post_written_on_4i" name="post[written_on(4i)]">\n)
  0.upto(23) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 15}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " - "

  expected << %Q(<select id="post_written_on_5i" name="post[written_on(5i)]">\n)
  0.upto(59) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 16}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  expected << " - "

  expected << %Q(<select id="post_written_on_6i" name="post[written_on(6i)]">\n)
  0.upto(59) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 35}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, time_select("post", "written_on", { :time_separator => " - ", :include_seconds => true })
end
test_time_select_without_date_hidden_fields() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 2076
def test_time_select_without_date_hidden_fields
  @post = Post.new
  @post.written_on = Time.local(2004, 6, 15, 15, 16, 35)

  expected = %Q(<select id="post_written_on_4i" name="post[written_on(4i)]">\n)
  0.upto(23) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 15}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"
  expected << " : "
  expected << %Q(<select id="post_written_on_5i" name="post[written_on(5i)]">\n)
  0.upto(59) { |i| expected << %Q(<option value="#{sprintf("%02d", i)}"#{' selected="selected"' if i == 16}>#{sprintf("%02d", i)}</option>\n) }
  expected << "</select>\n"

  assert_dom_equal expected, time_select("post", "written_on", :ignore_date => true)
end
test_time_tag_pubdate_option() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 3203
def test_time_tag_pubdate_option
  assert_match(/<time.*pubdate="pubdate">.*<\/time>/, time_tag(Time.now, :pubdate => true))
end
test_time_tag_with_date() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 3191
def test_time_tag_with_date
  date = Date.new(2013, 2, 20)
  expected = '<time datetime="2013-02-20">February 20, 2013</time>'
  assert_equal expected, time_tag(date)
end
test_time_tag_with_different_format() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 3215
def test_time_tag_with_different_format
  time = Time.new(2013, 2, 20, 0, 0, 0, '+00:00')
  expected = '<time datetime="2013-02-20T00:00:00+00:00">20 Feb 00:00</time>'
  assert_equal expected, time_tag(time, :format => :short)
end
test_time_tag_with_given_block() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 3211
def test_time_tag_with_given_block
  assert_match(/<time.*><span>Right now<\/span><\/time>/, time_tag(Time.now){ '<span>Right now</span>'.html_safe })
end

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 3207
def test_time_tag_with_given_text
  assert_match(/<time.*>Right now<\/time>/, time_tag(Time.now, 'Right now'))
end
test_time_tag_with_time() Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 3197
def test_time_tag_with_time
  time = Time.new(2013, 2, 20, 0, 0, 0, '+00:00')
  expected = '<time datetime="2013-02-20T00:00:00+00:00">February 20, 2013 00:00</time>'
  assert_equal expected, time_tag(time)
end
to_param() Link

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 15
def to_param
  '123'
end
Instance Protected methods
with_env_tz(new_tz = 'US/Eastern') Link

Source: show | on GitHub 

# File actionview/test/template/date_helper_test.rb, line 3222
def with_env_tz(new_tz = 'US/Eastern')
  old_tz, ENV['TZ'] = ENV['TZ'], new_tz
  yield
ensure
  old_tz ? ENV['TZ'] = old_tz : ENV.delete('TZ')
end
